title: Java developers for projects within transportation, connectivity and aerospace
displayTitle: Java developers for projects within transportation, connectivity and aerospace
jobDescription:
We are an international consultancy company focused in the
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              high tech-, embedded- and software engineering areas.
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              At MCA we know that our employees are our biggest strength,
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              so we are dedicated to support their career
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              and development within the company.
             
            
          
         
        
       
      
     
     
      
       
        
         
          
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              Java developers for projects within transportation, connectivity and aerospace
             
            
          
         
         
         
          
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              Are you a skilled Java developer with a passion for building robust, scalable applications using Spring Boot and AWS? At MCA Sweden, we’re looking for talented Java developers to join our consulting team and work with exciting clients. As a consultant, you’ll develop cutting-edge software solutions that power the future of transportation, connectivity and aerospace.
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              What you’ll do:
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              • Design, develop, and maintain microservices-based applications using Java and Spring Boot to meet client requirements for scalability and performance. • Build and integrate RESTful APIs and event-driven architectures using tools like Apache Kafka or AWS SQS for seamless communication between systems. • Deploy and manage applications on AWS, leveraging services like EC2, Lambda, S3, RDS, and API Gateway to ensure high availability and efficiency. • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including DevOps engineers and product managers, to deliver high-quality software solutions. • Implement unit testing and integration testing using frameworks like JUnit, TestNG, or Mockito to ensure code reliability and maintainability. • Participate in agile development processes, contributing to sprint planning, code reviews, and continuous improvement initiatives. • Optimize application performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure adherence to security best practices in cloud-based environments. • Document technical designs, workflows, and processes to support client deliverables and knowledge sharing.
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              What we’re looking for:
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              • 5+ years of hands-on experience in Java development, with a focus on microservices architectures. • Strong proficiency in Java 8+, Spring Boot and Spring Framework. • Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs and working with message queues (e.g., Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, or AWS SQS). • Hands-on experience with AWS services (e.g., EC2, Lambda, S3, RDS, DynamoDB, API Gateway). • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools like Jenkins, GitLab, or AWS CodePipeline for automated deployments. • Knowledge of containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              Why join MCA Sweden?
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
              • Develop your career through projects at cutting-edge companies in the automotive, aerospace and connected solutions industries. • Join a dynamic and experienced consulting team. MCA consultants holds an average of 9.4 years of experience. • We value innovation, professional growth, and work-life balance. • Access training and certification opportunities to advance your career. • Make a lasting impact by delivering scalable, secure solutions for some of the world’s most innovative companies.
             
            
           
           
            
             
              
             
             
             
             
            
          
         
        
       
      
    
   
   
   
    #LI-FE1

title: Ignition Automation Developer
jobDescription:
Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad. 
  Din roll
  SAAB är på en resa mot Industri 4.0 och vi behöver stärka teamet med en utvecklare som arbetar med vår Ignition plattform. Att ha bakgrundskunskap inom IIOT, PLC, HMI och SCADA är meriterande för att bygga lösningar mot Saabs olika enheter/ affärsområden. På sektionen jobbar idag cirka 15 personer och verksamheten är fördelad både geografiskt och över ett antal olika team. På arbetsplatsen finns en prestigelös kultur där man är professionell och engagerad, respekterar, stöttar och lär av varandra, resultat når vi tillsammans som ett team.
   Som Industrial Automation Engineer kommer du att arbeta i ett DevOps-team och ha en viktig roll inom framförallt utveckling men även förvaltning av Ignition plattformen. I din nya roll kommer du arbeta nära Service Manager, Scrum master, Solution Architects och Data Engineers. För att trivas i den här rollen behöver du ha ett intresse för industriella processer och produktionsmiljöer samt ett genuint intresse för utveckling och support av mjukvara inom IIOT/SCADA-området. Du kommer även att få hantera affärsmässiga krav från våra internkunder och verksamhetsprocesser.
  Din profil
  Vi letar efter en noggrann och metodisk problemlösare, gärna med minst 5 års erfarenhet inom området, som är van vid att ta ansvar och arbeta självgående. Du har starka analytiska färdigheter, en god förmåga att strukturera och dokumentera ditt arbete samt ett öga för detaljer. Kommunikation är avgörande för oss, och vi värdesätter därför din sociala kompetens och förmåga att arbeta i team.
  Vi tror att du som söker har:
  
   Starka kunskaper inom Java-programmering för utveckling av skräddarsydda moduler och komponenter i Ignition.
   Djupgående kunskap om Ignition-plattformens olika komponenter, inklusive moduler, klienter och databasintegration.
   Färdigheter inom SQL för att skapa och hantera databaser samt förståelse för hur man integrerar databaser med Ignition-projekt.
   Kunskap om webbteknologier som HTML, CSS, JavaScript och RESTful API för att skapa responsiva och användarvänliga gränssnitt i Ignition.
   Förståelse för vanliga industriella kommunikationsprotokoll som OPC UA, Modbus och MQTT för att integrera olika enheter och system med Ignition.
  
  
   Erfarenhet av att arbeta med SCADA-system och förståelse för dess arkitektur och funktioner.
   Erfarenhet av HighByte Intelligence Hub är meriterande men inte ett krav.
  
  Vi förväntar oss även att du har god förståelse för versionshanteringsverktyg, såsom Git, för att effektivt hantera källkod och samarbeta med andra utvecklare. Du har vana att utföra enhetstester och felsökning av kod för att säkerställa att Ignition-projekt fungerar felfritt och är robusta. En stark förståelse för säkerhetsprinciper och bästa praxis är avgörande för att skydda projekt mot potentiella säkerhetshot. Dessutom har du förmågan att skriva tydlig och omfattande dokumentation för både kod, konfiguration och användning av Ignition-projekt, vilket underlättar både underhåll och vidareutveckling.
   Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
  Vad du blir en del av
  Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
  Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
  Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
  Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här  Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

Din roll

SAAB är på en resa mot Industri 4.0 och vi behöver stärka teamet med en utvecklare som arbetar med vår Ignition plattform. Att ha bakgrundskunskap inom IIOT, PLC, HMI och SCADA är meriterande för att bygga lösningar mot Saabs olika enheter/ affärsområden. På sektionen jobbar idag cirka 15 personer och verksamheten är fördelad både geografiskt och över ett antal olika team. På arbetsplatsen finns en prestigelös kultur där man är professionell och engagerad, respekterar, stöttar och lär av varandra, resultat når vi tillsammans som ett team.


Som Industrial Automation Engineer kommer du att arbeta i ett DevOps-team och ha en viktig roll inom framförallt utveckling men även förvaltning av Ignition plattformen. I din nya roll kommer du arbeta nära Service Manager, Scrum master, Solution Architects och Data Engineers. För att trivas i den här rollen behöver du ha ett intresse för industriella processer och produktionsmiljöer samt ett genuint intresse för utveckling och support av mjukvara inom IIOT/SCADA-området. Du kommer även att få hantera affärsmässiga krav från våra internkunder och verksamhetsprocesser.

Din profil

Vi letar efter en noggrann och metodisk problemlösare, gärna med minst 5 års erfarenhet inom området, som är van vid att ta ansvar och arbeta självgående. Du har starka analytiska färdigheter, en god förmåga att strukturera och dokumentera ditt arbete samt ett öga för detaljer. Kommunikation är avgörande för oss, och vi värdesätter därför din sociala kompetens och förmåga att arbeta i team.

Vi tror att du som söker har:

  • Starka kunskaper inom Java-programmering för utveckling av skräddarsydda moduler och komponenter i Ignition.
  • Djupgående kunskap om Ignition-plattformens olika komponenter, inklusive moduler, klienter och databasintegration.
  • Färdigheter inom SQL för att skapa och hantera databaser samt förståelse för hur man integrerar databaser med Ignition-projekt.
  • Kunskap om webbteknologier som HTML, CSS, JavaScript och RESTful API för att skapa responsiva och användarvänliga gränssnitt i Ignition.
  • Förståelse för vanliga industriella kommunikationsprotokoll som OPC UA, Modbus och MQTT för att integrera olika enheter och system med Ignition.
  • Erfarenhet av att arbeta med SCADA-system och förståelse för dess arkitektur och funktioner.
  • Erfarenhet av HighByte Intelligence Hub är meriterande men inte ett krav.

Vi förväntar oss även att du har god förståelse för versionshanteringsverktyg, såsom Git, för att effektivt hantera källkod och samarbeta med andra utvecklare. Du har vana att utföra enhetstester och felsökning av kod för att säkerställa att Ignition-projekt fungerar felfritt och är robusta. En stark förståelse för säkerhetsprinciper och bästa praxis är avgörande för att skydda projekt mot potentiella säkerhetshot. Dessutom har du förmågan att skriva tydlig och omfattande dokumentation för både kod, konfiguration och användning av Ignition-projekt, vilket underlättar både underhåll och vidareutveckling.

Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.

Vad du blir en del av

Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.

Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.

Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här

Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: Backend Developer - Checkout
jobDescription:
Empowering merchants, enabling seamless shopping.
 At Walley, we are building payment solutions that make shopping experiences smooth and secure for millions of customers every year. Our Checkout domain is at the heart of that mission, and we are now looking for a Backend Developer who wants to help us take it to the next level.
  About the Role
 As part of our Checkout domain, you will work with one of Walley's most business-critical products, the checkout platform that handles thousands of transactions every day. We follow a DevOps mindset, taking full ownership from idea to production, and continuously improving performance, reliability, and scalability.
 You will work in a cross-functional, autonomous team that values quality, collaboration, and learning. Every line of code you write can have a real impact, both on our customers and our business.
  What You Will Do
 
  Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services in .NET and C#
  Develop and optimize cloud-native systems in Azure
  Work with infrastructure as code using Terraform
  Ensure observability, maintainability, and performance across our systems
  Collaborate closely with other developers, product managers, and designers to create high-quality, data-driven solutions
  Contribute to continuous improvement and modern DevOps practices
 
  What We Are Looking For
 We believe you are an experienced developer who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys taking responsibility for the entire product lifecycle. You are pragmatic, curious, and humble, and you care about code quality, readability, and security.
  You likely have:
 
  5+ years of backend experience, primarily in .NET and C#
  Proven experience with Azure and Terraform
  A DevOps mindset and experience with continuous deployment and cloud-native architectures
  Hands-on experience with several of the following:
   
    Azure Service Bus, CosmosDB, Elasticsearch
    Kibana, Grafana
    Kubernetes, ArgoCD
    Akka
   
  An interest in e-commerce, fintech, or high-transaction systems
 
 
  How We Work
 We work in a hybrid setup, with our main office located at Lilla Bommen in Gothenburg. Three days a week we collaborate on-site to share ideas, build knowledge, and move faster together. Walley is a tech-driven, autonomous part of Norion Bank (formerly Collector Bank). Since 2005, we have been helping merchants across the Nordics grow through smarter, more flexible payment solutions.
  Why Join Us
 
  Work with modern technology in a high-impact product area
  Be part of a humble and skilled team that values collaboration and learning
  Have autonomy and influence over tools, methods, and processes
  Help shape the quality culture of one of the Nordics’ leading checkout solutions
  Ready to build and ensure the quality of the next generation of checkout experiences?
 
 Join us at Walley, where great technology meets real-world impact.
  ABOUT WALLEY
 Walley is one of the largest payment providers in the Nordics with more than 6 million active end customers over the past year. We're a tech-driven, autonomous part of the Norion Bank group and have been working with payment solutions and digital purchase journeys since 2005. Walley's product organization is divided into seven autonomous product teams. Team MyWalley takes over the customer journey after a purchase is made. We're responsible for MyWalley & App, one of the most downloaded fintech apps in the Nordics. The product you'll help build is used by millions of customers!
  NORION BANK’S OFFER TO YOU
 At Norion Bank, we believe that every individual's growth and development should be highly valued. This means a strong focus on self-leadership and continuous competence development. A sense of community, innovation, and modern ways of working are key characteristics of Norion Bank Group. In short, we offer an organization with short decision-making paths, great openness, and plenty of energy. Our core values - Professionalism, Commitment, and Care - permeate everything we do. As part of our team, you will contribute to and be shaped by our strong company culture. We offer you an exciting workplace with excellent opportunities for growth, continuous learning, and shared activities both inside and outside the workplace.
  BIAS-FREE RECRUITMENT
 We want our recruitment process to be fair and inclusive. Therefore, we kindly ask you not to attach a photo or include any information that is not relevant to the position. A personal letter is not required.
  INTERESTED?
 Great! We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait - apply today! Have any questions? You're very welcome to get in touch with us! For questions about the team or the role, please contact Jakob Ramlöw at Jakob.ramlow@walley.se
jobDescriptionHTML:
Empowering merchants, enabling seamless shopping.

At Walley, we are building payment solutions that make shopping experiences smooth and secure for millions of customers every year. Our Checkout domain is at the heart of that mission, and we are now looking for a Backend Developer who wants to help us take it to the next level.

About the Role

As part of our Checkout domain, you will work with one of Walley's most business-critical products, the checkout platform that handles thousands of transactions every day. We follow a DevOps mindset, taking full ownership from idea to production, and continuously improving performance, reliability, and scalability.

You will work in a cross-functional, autonomous team that values quality, collaboration, and learning. Every line of code you write can have a real impact, both on our customers and our business.

What You Will Do

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services in .NET and C#
  • Develop and optimize cloud-native systems in Azure
  • Work with infrastructure as code using Terraform
  • Ensure observability, maintainability, and performance across our systems
  • Collaborate closely with other developers, product managers, and designers to create high-quality, data-driven solutions
  • Contribute to continuous improvement and modern DevOps practices

What We Are Looking For

We believe you are an experienced developer who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys taking responsibility for the entire product lifecycle. You are pragmatic, curious, and humble, and you care about code quality, readability, and security.

You likely have:

  • 5+ years of backend experience, primarily in .NET and C#
  • Proven experience with Azure and Terraform
  • A DevOps mindset and experience with continuous deployment and cloud-native architectures
  • Hands-on experience with several of the following:
    • Azure Service Bus, CosmosDB, Elasticsearch
    • Kibana, Grafana
    • Kubernetes, ArgoCD
    • Akka
  • An interest in e-commerce, fintech, or high-transaction systems

How We Work

We work in a hybrid setup, with our main office located at Lilla Bommen in Gothenburg. Three days a week we collaborate on-site to share ideas, build knowledge, and move faster together. Walley is a tech-driven, autonomous part of Norion Bank (formerly Collector Bank). Since 2005, we have been helping merchants across the Nordics grow through smarter, more flexible payment solutions.

Why Join Us

  • Work with modern technology in a high-impact product area
  • Be part of a humble and skilled team that values collaboration and learning
  • Have autonomy and influence over tools, methods, and processes
  • Help shape the quality culture of one of the Nordics’ leading checkout solutions
  • Ready to build and ensure the quality of the next generation of checkout experiences?

Join us at Walley, where great technology meets real-world impact.

ABOUT WALLEY

Walley is one of the largest payment providers in the Nordics with more than 6 million active end customers over the past year. We're a tech-driven, autonomous part of the Norion Bank group and have been working with payment solutions and digital purchase journeys since 2005. Walley's product organization is divided into seven autonomous product teams. Team MyWalley takes over the customer journey after a purchase is made. We're responsible for MyWalley & App, one of the most downloaded fintech apps in the Nordics. The product you'll help build is used by millions of customers!

NORION BANK’S OFFER TO YOU

At Norion Bank, we believe that every individual's growth and development should be highly valued. This means a strong focus on self-leadership and continuous competence development. A sense of community, innovation, and modern ways of working are key characteristics of Norion Bank Group. In short, we offer an organization with short decision-making paths, great openness, and plenty of energy. Our core values - Professionalism, Commitment, and Care - permeate everything we do. As part of our team, you will contribute to and be shaped by our strong company culture. We offer you an exciting workplace with excellent opportunities for growth, continuous learning, and shared activities both inside and outside the workplace.

BIAS-FREE RECRUITMENT

We want our recruitment process to be fair and inclusive. Therefore, we kindly ask you not to attach a photo or include any information that is not relevant to the position. A personal letter is not required.

INTERESTED?

Great! We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait - apply today! Have any questions? You're very welcome to get in touch with us! For questions about the team or the role, please contact Jakob Ramlöw at Jakob.ramlow@walley.se

title: Android Platform Developer
jobDescription:

title: Senior Java / C# Developer
jobDescription:
Project description 
  Your team is based in our Lindholmen office, working closely together on-site. At the same time, our organization spans the globe — with teams and colleagues in Gothenburg, Lund, Europe, the US, and China — offering daily opportunities for international collaboration and knowledge sharing. You’ll be part of an empowered agile DevOps team developing backend services within the Location Services product area. Together, you’ll define, build, test, deploy, maintain, and operate secure applications — while continuously learning, improving, and delivering value. You’ll collaborate closely with your Product Owner to ensure the right functionality is developed and help estimate the size and complexity of upcoming work to support effective sprint planning. You’ll also take ownership of the technical design within your area, ensuring it aligns with our architectural guidelines and supports long-term scalability and maintainability. In this role, you’ll work with modern development tools, a microservice-oriented architecture and emerging technologies. You’ll have daily opportunities to learn from your peers, shape how we work, and contribute to building innovative, high-impact solutions.
 
 
  Responsibilities
  
   
    To thrive in this role, you need solid experience — at least five years — in Java /C# development, along with a bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or a related field. You should be confident working with backend technologies and have a strong grasp of the Spring Framework, DevOps practices, test automation, and system monitoring.
   
   
    Proficiency in tools and platforms such as Kubernetes, Kafka, PostgreSQL, and REST/gRPC is important, and experience handling car-related data — whether it's connected to the cloud, vehicles, mobile apps, or external partners — will be a strong advantage.
   
   
    A deep understanding of agile methodologies like Scaled Agile, Scrum, Lean, or Kanban is essential, as is prior experience working in cross-functional product teams. Fluency in English is required to navigate our global environment effectively.
   
   
    You should be genuinely passionate about product development, enjoy working in collaborative environments, and be committed to continuous learning. You bring a structured and thoughtful approach to decision-making—proactively requesting clarification and ensuring requirements are well-defined before committing to action. You avoid assumptions and promote alignment across teams.
   
   
    Equally important is your integrity and sense of accountability. You consistently hold yourself and others responsible for delivering on commitments, encouraging ownership, transparency, and follow-through. These qualities help foster a culture of trust, responsibility, and high performance.
   
   
    You should also be proactive in staying current with technology trends and eager to contribute ideas that improve both our products and development processes.
   
  
 
 
  Skills
  Must have
  
   
    Java and Spring Application development
   
   
    C# MongoDB, Cosmos DB
   
   
    Kubernetes, Azure Cloud Services
   
   
    Angular, Typescript
   
   
    Zabbix, Grafana (dashboard creation)
   
   
    Frameworks: Spring, Spring Boot
   
   
    Infrastructures: Docker, Kubernetes (K8s)
   
   
    Databases: PostgreSQL, Redis,
   
   
    Log: Splunk
   
   
    Middleware: Kafka, jGroups
   
   
    Tools: GitLab, Grafana, Prometheus, PagerDuty, ArgoCD,
   
   
    Task and Project/Code Management: GIT, Jira
   
   
    Methodologies: Agile (Scrum, Kanban), Scaled Agile, DevOps
   
   
    Security: mTLS, Oauth
   
   
    Other: WebService (REST/gRPC), Junit Testing, Maven
   
   
    Experience from working in a Linux environment
   
   
    Experience in developing automated unit or integration test in Java
   
   
    Experience in working with Git
   
   
    Experience in working with Kafka
   
   
    Good English skill (written and spoken)
   
  
  Nice to have
  
   
    Experience within Automotive, Call Centers and from working in an international environment
   
   
    Knowledge in tools as; Jira, ArgoCD, Grafana, Splunk, Protobuf,
   
  
 
 
  Other
  
   
    
     Languages
     English: C1 Advanced
    
   
   
    
     Seniority
     Senior
    
   
  
 
 

 
  
   Goeteborg, Sweden
  
  Req. VR-118485
 
 
  
   Sweden, 411 04, Gothenburg, Lilla Bommen 6, 7th floor
  
 
 
 
  
   Java Full Stack
  
  
   Automotive Industry
  
  
   24/11/2025
  
  
   Req. VR-118485

Empowering merchants, enabling seamless shopping.
 At Walley, we build payment solutions that power millions of smooth and secure shopping experiences every year. Our Checkout team plays a key role in this mission, ensuring that every transaction is reliable, fast, and user-friendly.
 Our Checkout domain is at the heart of that mission, and we are now looking for a Fullstack Developer who wants to help us take it to the next level.
  About the Role
  As part of our Checkout team, you will contribute to one of Walley’s most business-critical products — the checkout platform that handles thousands of transactions every day. We follow a DevOps mindset, taking full ownership from idea to production, and continuously improving performance, reliability, and user experience.
 You will work in a cross-functional, autonomous team that values quality, collaboration, and learning. Every commit you make can have a real impact, both on our customers and our business.
  What You Will Do
 
  Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services in .NET and C#
  Contribute to frontend components using React
  Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other developers to create high-quality, data-driven solutions
  Ensure observability, maintainability, and performance across our systems
  Take part in deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement using modern DevOps practices
 
  What We Are Looking For
 We believe you are an experienced developer who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys taking responsibility for the whole product lifecycle. You are pragmatic, curious, and humble — and you care deeply about code quality, readability, and security.
 You likely have:
 
  5+ years of backend experience, primarily in .NET and C#
  3+ years of experience in frontend development, ideally React
  A DevOps mindset and experience with continuous deployment and cloud-native architectures
  Hands-on experience with several of the following:
   
    Azure, Azure Service Bus, CosmosDB, Elasticsearch
    Kibana, Grafana
    Kubernetes, ArgoCD
    Akka
   
  An interest in e-commerce, fintech, or high-transaction systems
 
 How We Work
 We work in a hybrid setup, with our main office located at Lilla Bommen in Gothenburg. Three days a week we collaborate on-site to share ideas, build knowledge, and move faster together. Walley is a tech-driven, autonomous part of Norion Bank (formerly Collector Bank). Since 2005, we have been helping merchants across the Nordics grow through smarter, more flexible payment solutions.
  Why Join Us
 
  Work with modern technology in a high-impact product area
  Be part of a humble and skilled team that values collaboration and learning
  Have autonomy and influence over tools, methods, and processes
  Help shape the quality culture of one of the Nordics’ leading checkout solutions
  Ready to build and ensure the quality of the next generation of checkout experiences?
 
 Join us at Walley, where great technology meets real-world impact.
  ABOUT WALLEY
 Walley is one of the largest payment providers in the Nordics with more than 6 million active end customers over the past year. We're a tech-driven, autonomous part of the Norion Bank group and have been working with payment solutions and digital purchase journeys since 2005. Walley's product organization is divided into seven autonomous product teams. Team MyWalley takes over the customer journey after a purchase is made. We're responsible for MyWalley & App, one of the most downloaded fintech apps in the Nordics. The product you'll help build is used by millions of customers!
  NORION BANK’S OFFER TO YOU
 At Norion Bank, we believe that every individual's growth and development should be highly valued. This means a strong focus on self-leadership and continuous competence development. A sense of community, innovation, and modern ways of working are key characteristics of Norion Bank Group. In short, we offer an organization with short decision-making paths, great openness, and plenty of energy. Our core values - Professionalism, Commitment, and Care - permeate everything we do. As part of our team, you will contribute to and be shaped by our strong company culture. We offer you an exciting workplace with excellent opportunities for growth, continuous learning, and shared activities both inside and outside the workplace.
  BIAS-FREE RECRUITMENT
 We want our recruitment process to be fair and inclusive. Therefore, we kindly ask you not to attach a photo or include any information that is not relevant to the position. A personal letter is not required.
  INTERESTED?
 Great! We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait - apply today! Have any questions? You're very welcome to get in touch with us! For questions about the team or the role, please contact Jakob Ramlöw at Jakob.ramlow@walley.se
jobDescriptionHTML:
Empowering merchants, enabling seamless shopping.

At Walley, we build payment solutions that power millions of smooth and secure shopping experiences every year. Our Checkout team plays a key role in this mission, ensuring that every transaction is reliable, fast, and user-friendly.

Our Checkout domain is at the heart of that mission, and we are now looking for a Fullstack Developer who wants to help us take it to the next level.

About the Role


As part of our Checkout team, you will contribute to one of Walley’s most business-critical products — the checkout platform that handles thousands of transactions every day. We follow a DevOps mindset, taking full ownership from idea to production, and continuously improving performance, reliability, and user experience.

You will work in a cross-functional, autonomous team that values quality, collaboration, and learning. Every commit you make can have a real impact, both on our customers and our business.

What You Will Do

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services in .NET and C#
  • Contribute to frontend components using React
  • Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other developers to create high-quality, data-driven solutions
  • Ensure observability, maintainability, and performance across our systems
  • Take part in deployment, monitoring, and continuous improvement using modern DevOps practices

What We Are Looking For

We believe you are an experienced developer who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys taking responsibility for the whole product lifecycle. You are pragmatic, curious, and humble — and you care deeply about code quality, readability, and security.

You likely have:

  • 5+ years of backend experience, primarily in .NET and C#
  • 3+ years of experience in frontend development, ideally React
  • A DevOps mindset and experience with continuous deployment and cloud-native architectures
  • Hands-on experience with several of the following:
    • Azure, Azure Service Bus, CosmosDB, Elasticsearch
    • Kibana, Grafana
    • Kubernetes, ArgoCD
    • Akka
  • An interest in e-commerce, fintech, or high-transaction systems

How We Work

We work in a hybrid setup, with our main office located at Lilla Bommen in Gothenburg. Three days a week we collaborate on-site to share ideas, build knowledge, and move faster together. Walley is a tech-driven, autonomous part of Norion Bank (formerly Collector Bank). Since 2005, we have been helping merchants across the Nordics grow through smarter, more flexible payment solutions.

Why Join Us

  • Work with modern technology in a high-impact product area
  • Be part of a humble and skilled team that values collaboration and learning
  • Have autonomy and influence over tools, methods, and processes
  • Help shape the quality culture of one of the Nordics’ leading checkout solutions
  • Ready to build and ensure the quality of the next generation of checkout experiences?

Join us at Walley, where great technology meets real-world impact.

ABOUT WALLEY

Walley is one of the largest payment providers in the Nordics with more than 6 million active end customers over the past year. We're a tech-driven, autonomous part of the Norion Bank group and have been working with payment solutions and digital purchase journeys since 2005. Walley's product organization is divided into seven autonomous product teams. Team MyWalley takes over the customer journey after a purchase is made. We're responsible for MyWalley & App, one of the most downloaded fintech apps in the Nordics. The product you'll help build is used by millions of customers!

NORION BANK’S OFFER TO YOU

At Norion Bank, we believe that every individual's growth and development should be highly valued. This means a strong focus on self-leadership and continuous competence development. A sense of community, innovation, and modern ways of working are key characteristics of Norion Bank Group. In short, we offer an organization with short decision-making paths, great openness, and plenty of energy. Our core values - Professionalism, Commitment, and Care - permeate everything we do. As part of our team, you will contribute to and be shaped by our strong company culture. We offer you an exciting workplace with excellent opportunities for growth, continuous learning, and shared activities both inside and outside the workplace.

BIAS-FREE RECRUITMENT

We want our recruitment process to be fair and inclusive. Therefore, we kindly ask you not to attach a photo or include any information that is not relevant to the position. A personal letter is not required.

INTERESTED?

Great! We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait - apply today! Have any questions? You're very welcome to get in touch with us! For questions about the team or the role, please contact Jakob Ramlöw at Jakob.ramlow@walley.se

title: Senior Fullstack Developer with Generative AI experience
displayTitle: Senior Fullstack Developer with Generative AI experience
jobDescription:
Tired of the same old code and solutions? Ready to dive into greenfield projects and sprinkle some Generative AI magic into your work? Devoteam Creative Tech in Gothenburg is on the hunt for a Senior Fullstack Developer who thrives on innovation, loves a good challenge, and has a knack for turning fresh ideas into tangible products. If you're passionate about building cutting-edge solutions and want the freedom to explore new tech, this is your stage!About Devoteam Creative Tech We're not just consultants; we're "Tech for People." Devoteam is an AI-driven tech consulting firm that's been guiding businesses through the tech landscape for 30 years. In our Creative Tech entity, we're all about crafting innovative, tailor-made solutions and fostering long-term partnerships. We believe in empowering our people, encouraging continuous learning, and fostering an environment where your ambition can truly flourish.Your Mission (Should You Choose to Accept It) As a Senior Fullstack Developer with us, you'll be a key player in working on exciting new projects with our clients. This isn't about maintaining legacy systems; it's about building from the ground up, with plenty of room to experiment and innovate. You'll primarily work at client offices in Gothenburg 2-3 days a week, collaborating closely with their teams and your Devoteam colleagues.You'll get to: 
 
  Architect and develop robust backend solutions using .NET, ensuring scalability and top-notch performance.
  Craft beautiful, responsive, and intuitive user interfaces with CSS and modern frontend frameworks like React.js.
  Be hands-on with Azure, leveraging its powerful services to deploy and manage applications.
  Dive into Generative AI projects, exploring new ways to integrate AI into products and solutions – this is where you get to truly innovate!
  Ensure code quality and reliability through Cypress for end-to-end testing.
  Work with messaging queues like Amazon SQS to build highly decoupled and resilient systems.
  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, bringing fresh perspectives and solutions to the table.
  Have the opportunity to work with brand-new codebases, fresh solutions, and exciting products that are just beginning their journey.
 What Makes You Our Ideal Candidate? 
 
  You're a Senior Developer with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software.
  You have solid experience with .NET for backend development.
  You're proficient in CSS and skilled in building engaging user experiences.
  Hands-on experience with Azure is a must.
  You're comfortable with Cypress for testing and ensuring robust applications.
  Familiarity with messaging services, particularly Amazon SQS, is a big plus.
  You've dipped your toes into Generative AI projects or have a burning desire to do so and apply it to real-world products.
  You thrive in dynamic, client-facing environments and love the challenge of varied projects.
  You're a natural problem-solver, innovative, and eager to explore new technologies.
  Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.
 What we offer?  Great location: A nice office in the centre of GothenburgContinuous learning: We support continuous learning with biweekly knowledge-sharing groups, participation in Øredev and ongoing competence development days for your professional development. You have the opportunity to take a certificate with one of our partners (AWS, Azure, GCP) and have access to all Udemy courses.Leave and pension: We offer 30 days of vacation, supplementary parental leave compensation and occupational pension according to ITP1.Health and well-being: Obvious benefits such as wellness allowance, access to occupational health care, health checks and lunch-yoga in the office.Tools and equipment: You choose the tools you need to deliver and thrive in your work environment.   Coworkers: Great, skilled coworkers who appreciate fun activities and techtalks.   If you're ready to devote your talent to a company that appreciates quality, fosters growth, and values its people, don't wait! Apply now and let's build something amazing together.   Ps. We're currently enjoying our summer break, so things are a bit slow right now. We'll be reviewing applications like yours once we're back and fully refreshed. We appreciate your patience and look forward to getting in touch soon!
jobDescriptionHTML:
• Tired of the same old code and solutions? Ready to dive into greenfield projects and sprinkle some Generative AI magic into your work?

    Devoteam Creative Tech in Gothenburg is on the hunt for a Senior Fullstack Developer who thrives on innovation, loves a good challenge, and has a knack for turning fresh ideas into tangible products. If you're passionate about building cutting-edge solutions and want the freedom to explore new tech, this is your stage!

    About Devoteam Creative Tech

    We're not just consultants; we're "Tech for People." Devoteam is an AI-driven tech consulting firm that's been guiding businesses through the tech landscape for 30 years. In our Creative Tech entity, we're all about crafting innovative, tailor-made solutions and fostering long-term partnerships. We believe in empowering our people, encouraging continuous learning, and fostering an environment where your ambition can truly flourish.

    Your Mission (Should You Choose to Accept It)

    As a Senior Fullstack Developer with us, you'll be a key player in working on exciting new projects with our clients. This isn't about maintaining legacy systems; it's about building from the ground up, with plenty of room to experiment and innovate. You'll primarily work at client offices in Gothenburg 2-3 days a week, collaborating closely with their teams and your Devoteam colleagues.

    You'll get to:

    • Architect and develop robust backend solutions using .NET, ensuring scalability and top-notch performance.

    • Craft beautiful, responsive, and intuitive user interfaces with CSS and modern frontend frameworks like React.js.

    • Be hands-on with Azure, leveraging its powerful services to deploy and manage applications.

    • Dive into Generative AI projects, exploring new ways to integrate AI into products and solutions – this is where you get to truly innovate!

    • Ensure code quality and reliability through Cypress for end-to-end testing.

    • Work with messaging queues like Amazon SQS to build highly decoupled and resilient systems.

    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, bringing fresh perspectives and solutions to the table.

    • Have the opportunity to work with brand-new codebases, fresh solutions, and exciting products that are just beginning their journey.

    What Makes You Our Ideal Candidate?

    • You're a Senior Developer with a proven track record of delivering high-quality software.

    • You have solid experience with .NET for backend development.

    • You're proficient in CSS and skilled in building engaging user experiences.

    • Hands-on experience with Azure is a must.

    • You're comfortable with Cypress for testing and ensuring robust applications.

    • Familiarity with messaging services, particularly Amazon SQS, is a big plus.

    • You've dipped your toes into Generative AI projects or have a burning desire to do so and apply it to real-world products.

    • You thrive in dynamic, client-facing environments and love the challenge of varied projects.

    • You're a natural problem-solver, innovative, and eager to explore new technologies.

    • Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English.

    What we offer?
    Great location: A nice office in the centre of Gothenburg

    Continuous learning: We support continuous learning with biweekly knowledge-sharing groups, participation in Øredev and ongoing competence development days for your professional development. You have the opportunity to take a certificate with one of our partners (AWS, Azure, GCP) and have access to all Udemy courses.

    Leave and pension: We offer 30 days of vacation, supplementary parental leave compensation and occupational pension according to ITP1.

    Health and well-being: Obvious benefits such as wellness allowance, access to occupational health care, health checks and lunch-yoga in the office.

    Tools and equipment: You choose the tools you need to deliver and thrive in your work environment.

    Coworkers: Great, skilled coworkers who appreciate fun activities and techtalks.

    If you're ready to devote your talent to a company that appreciates quality, fosters growth, and values its people, don't wait! Apply now and let's build something amazing together.

    Ps. We're currently enjoying our summer break, so things are a bit slow right now. We'll be reviewing applications like yours once we're back and fully refreshed.

    We appreciate your patience and look forward to getting in touch soon!

title: Senior .Net Systemutvecklare
jobDescription:
Vi söker en erfaren Senior .NET Systemutvecklare som vill arbeta med moderna webbapplikationer och bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens systemlösningar. Hos oss blir du en viktig del av ett utvecklingsteam där samarbete, innovation och kvalitet står i fokus.
Arbetsuppgifter

 Vidareutveckla och förbättra befintliga system i C#, ASP.NET och MS SQL Server
 Utveckla nya funktioner och lösningar tillsammans med teamet
 Delta i tekniska förbättringar, buggrättningar och systemmigreringar
 Arbeta med frontend i Angular och JavaScript
 Påverka både teknikval och arbetssätt i teamet

Vi söker dig som

 Har flera års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom .NET och C#
 Har eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet
 Är van att jobba i team och i agila utvecklingsmiljöer
 Är engagerad, prestigelös och lösningsorienterad
 Vill vara med och driva både tekniska och organisatoriska förbättringar

Vi erbjuder

 Flexibelt arbetssätt med möjlighet till hybridarbete (kontor + distans)
 Frihet under ansvar och en kultur som främjar samarbete
 Friskvårdsbidrag och sociala aktiviteter som afterworks och teamdagar
 Tid för att utforska nya tekniker och idéer
 Moderna kontorslokaler i centrala Göteborg

Ansökan
Skicka in din ansökan via Indeed redan idag! Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
Vid frågor eller kontakt, ring eller sms:a Robin Furberg på 0721829544
Jobbtyp: Heltid
Arbetsort: På plats

title: Embeddedutvecklare C/C++
jobDescription:
Nexer Engineering växer i Göteborg! Brinner du för att lösa tekniska utmaningar och vill vara med och forma framtidens inbyggda system? Vi söker dig som vill vara en del av Göteborgs bästa konsultgrupp. Tillsammans är vi i framkant och skapar innovativa lösningar för våra kunder, utvecklar oss själva och har riktigt kul på vägen!
  Om Nexer Engineering i Göteborg
 Inom affärsområdet Nexer Engineering samarbetar vi med branschledande företag och är specialiserade på produktutveckling och tillverkning. Vårt främsta fokus är på uppdrag inom bland annat försvarssektorn och fordonsindustrin, där vi täcker kompetensområdena inom allt från embedded till produktnära mjukvaruutveckling.
 Vi arbetar med långsiktiga uppdrag, och när du känner att det är dags för en ny utmaning så finns det goda möjligheter att växa vidare genom Nexer. Vi ger dig stöd och den kompetensutveckling som behövs för att kunna vidareutvecklas i den riktning som du vill.
  Om rollen
 För att lyckas i konsultrollen som embeddedutvecklare ser vi att du har minst fem års erfarenheter inom inbyggda system och utbildningsbakgrund inom Computer Science, Electrical Engineering eller liknande. Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, såväl i tal som i skrift.
  Vi ser gärna att du har: 
 
  Erfarenhet av inbyggda system
  C/C++
  Linux
  God kommunikationsförmåga i både svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift
 
  Meriterande:
 
  Python, Ada, Assembly
  RTOS
  FPGA/VHDL
 
 Som konsult är du anställd av Nexer och har ditt hemmakontor hos oss i Göteborg, där dörren alltid står öppen för dig oavsett uppdragets placering.
  Ansökan
 Känner du igen dig i beskrivningen ovan och tycker att Nexer låter som rätt plats för dig? Då ser vi verkligen fram emot att läsa din ansökan! Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.
  Mer om Nexer som arbetsgivare
  Jobbar du på Nexer får du en modig och entreprenörsdriven arbetsgivare med internationell närvaro. Vi är stolta över att leda den digitala revolutionen och vara i teknikens framkant, alltid med ett agilt och framåtlutat förhållningssätt. Här får du unika möjligheter att drömma stort, agera smart och utvecklas. Vi är ett familjeägt bolag med långsiktiga strategier, vilket innebär att du är nära de som fattar beslut och kan vara med och påverka.
  Vår kultur
  Vår vision är Promising future – det är viktigt för oss att göra skillnad och bidra till en bättre framtid. Vi har ett engagemang för våra kunder och en uppriktig omtanke om varandra. Vi omfamnar mångfald och tror att människor med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter gör vårt arbete och vårt företag bättre. Vi värdesätter innovation och viljan att utvecklas och ta nästa steg – framåt och uppåt. Dessutom har vi roligt på jobbet!
 #LI-VO1

title: Mobile Developer to Walley!
jobDescription:
Team MyWalley is looking for a developer who wants to work on a product used by millions, together with a self-organizing, low-ego team. You’ll help shape the future of e-commerce together with some of the Nordics’ biggest brands — working data-driven and accessibility-first (EU Web Accessibility Directive / WCAG 2.1).
  What You’ll Do
 
  Work in Swift and Kotlin hybrid apps with our embedded web app
  Ensure our embedded web app communicates and uses native functionality in a good way where needed (biometrics, push notifications)
  Take a lead on, improve, and tweak our App Store integrations (Apple App Store and Google Play Store)
  Collaborate with design, QA, and backend teams to deliver the best possible user experience
  Optimize for security, performance, and scalability
  Influence technical solutions and product direction
  Ship multiple times per week with high quality
  Deliver value to both our users and Walley as a business
 
 Who You Are
 You’re an experienced mobile developer with a strong product mindset and passion for delivering great user experiences. You’re pragmatic, curious, and enjoy working closely with design and product — always striving for clean, maintainable code.
 You likely have:
 
  5+ years of experience in modern mobile development (Kotlin and/or Swift)
  Expertise in either Swift or Kotlin, with solid knowledge of the other
  Experience shipping consumer products at scale
  Skills in SwiftUI and Jetpack Compose
  Comfort working closely with UX and design tools (Figma)
  Strong product sense and pragmatic technical decision-making
  Appreciation for pairing, unit tests, and code reviews
 
 What You’ll Get
 
  Autonomy with accountability in a senior, supportive team
  Real user impact — millions of users and fast feedback loops
  Hybrid setup (3 days in office) and flexible working hours
  Great perks: office massage, wellness allowance, and the option to convert salary into extra vacation days
  Competitive compensation based on experience and competence
 
 Our Tech Stack
 Swift, SwiftUI, Kotlin, React, TypeScript, Sass (SCSS), GraphQL, .NET/C# Azure (Service Bus, Table Storage, CosmosDB), Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, Grafana, Elasticsearch
  Why Join Walley
 Walley is a tech-driven, autonomous part of Norion Bank (formerly Collector Bank). Since 2005, we’ve helped merchants across the Nordics grow through smarter, more flexible payment solutions. At Walley, quality, impact, and collaboration are key — and every line of code you write will contribute to creating seamless shopping experiences for millions.
  Ready to shape the future of e-commerce? Join us at Walley — where great technology meets real-world impact.
  ABOUT WALLEY
 Walley is one of the largest payment providers in the Nordics with more than 6 million active end customers over the past year. We're a tech-driven, autonomous part of the Norion Bank group and have been working with payment solutions and digital purchase journeys since 2005. Walley's product organization is divided into seven autonomous product teams. Team MyWalley takes over the customer journey after a purchase is made. We're responsible for MyWalley & App, one of the most downloaded fintech apps in the Nordics. The product you'll help build is used by millions of customers!
  NORION BANK’S OFFER TO YOU
 At Norion Bank, we believe that every individual's growth and development should be highly valued. This means a strong focus on self-leadership and continuous competence development. A sense of community, innovation, and modern ways of working are key characteristics of Norion Bank Group. In short, we offer an organization with short decision-making paths, great openness, and plenty of energy. Our core values - Professionalism, Commitment, and Care - permeate everything we do. As part of our team, you will contribute to and be shaped by our strong company culture. We offer you an exciting workplace with excellent opportunities for growth, continuous learning, and shared activities both inside and outside the workplace.
  BIAS-FREE RECRUITMENT
 We want our recruitment process to be fair and inclusive. Therefore, we kindly ask you not to attach a photo or include any information that is not relevant to the position. A personal letter is not required.
  INTERESTED?
 Great! We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait - apply today! Have any questions? You're very welcome to get in touch with us! For questions about the team or the role, please contact Elsa Karlsson at Elsa.karlsson@norionbank.se

  • Collaborate with design, QA, and backend teams to deliver the best possible user experience
  • Optimize for security, performance, and scalability
  • Influence technical solutions and product direction
  • Ship multiple times per week with high quality
  • Deliver value to both our users and Walley as a business

Who You Are

You’re an experienced mobile developer with a strong product mindset and passion for delivering great user experiences. You’re pragmatic, curious, and enjoy working closely with design and product — always striving for clean, maintainable code.

You likely have:

  • 5+ years of experience in modern mobile development (Kotlin and/or Swift)
  • Expertise in either Swift or Kotlin, with solid knowledge of the other
  • Experience shipping consumer products at scale
  • Skills in SwiftUI and Jetpack Compose
  • Comfort working closely with UX and design tools (Figma)
  • Strong product sense and pragmatic technical decision-making
  • Appreciation for pairing, unit tests, and code reviews

What You’ll Get

  • Autonomy with accountability in a senior, supportive team
  • Real user impact — millions of users and fast feedback loops
  • Hybrid setup (3 days in office) and flexible working hours
  • Great perks: office massage, wellness allowance, and the option to convert salary into extra vacation days
  • Competitive compensation based on experience and competence

Our Tech Stack

Swift, SwiftUI, Kotlin, React, TypeScript, Sass (SCSS), GraphQL, .NET/C#
Azure (Service Bus, Table Storage, CosmosDB), Azure DevOps, Kubernetes, Grafana, Elasticsearch

Why Join Walley

Walley is a tech-driven, autonomous part of Norion Bank (formerly Collector Bank). Since 2005, we’ve helped merchants across the Nordics grow through smarter, more flexible payment solutions. At Walley, quality, impact, and collaboration are key — and every line of code you write will contribute to creating seamless shopping experiences for millions.

Ready to shape the future of e-commerce?
Join us at Walley — where great technology meets real-world impact.

ABOUT WALLEY

Walley is one of the largest payment providers in the Nordics with more than 6 million active end customers over the past year. We're a tech-driven, autonomous part of the Norion Bank group and have been working with payment solutions and digital purchase journeys since 2005. Walley's product organization is divided into seven autonomous product teams. Team MyWalley takes over the customer journey after a purchase is made. We're responsible for MyWalley & App, one of the most downloaded fintech apps in the Nordics. The product you'll help build is used by millions of customers!

NORION BANK’S OFFER TO YOU

At Norion Bank, we believe that every individual's growth and development should be highly valued. This means a strong focus on self-leadership and continuous competence development. A sense of community, innovation, and modern ways of working are key characteristics of Norion Bank Group. In short, we offer an organization with short decision-making paths, great openness, and plenty of energy. Our core values - Professionalism, Commitment, and Care - permeate everything we do. As part of our team, you will contribute to and be shaped by our strong company culture. We offer you an exciting workplace with excellent opportunities for growth, continuous learning, and shared activities both inside and outside the workplace.

BIAS-FREE RECRUITMENT

We want our recruitment process to be fair and inclusive. Therefore, we kindly ask you not to attach a photo or include any information that is not relevant to the position. A personal letter is not required.

INTERESTED?

Great! We review applications and conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait - apply today! Have any questions? You're very welcome to get in touch with us! For questions about the team or the role, please contact Elsa Karlsson at Elsa.karlsson@norionbank.se

title: Inbyggd utvecklare | Göteborg
jobDescription:
Letar du efter din nästa utmaning som Embedded Software Engineer inom fordonsindustrin? Då ska du läsa vidare!
   ALTEN Sweden söker just nu en skicklig och erfaren Embedded Software Engineer med stark kompetens inom C-programmering och AUTOSAR-utveckling för ett av våra nyckeluppdrag inom fordonssektorn. Tjänsten är 100% på plats i Göteborg.
   Du blir en del av ett högpresterande ingenjörsteam som arbetar med design, implementering och integration av inbyggd mjukvara för nästa generations fordonsplattformar.
   
  
 
 
  
   VAD VI ERBJUDER
   
    Utmanande uppdrag hos ledande fordonstillverkare och Tier 1-leverantörer.
    En stark ingenjörskultur och internationella, samarbetande team.
    Stödjande ledarskap med fokus på människor och utveckling.
    Möjlighet att utforska olika branscher där våra kunder är verksamma.
    En personlig utbildningsbudget för interna eller externa kurser.
   
   OM ROLLEN
   Som Embedded Software Engineer ansvarar du för att utveckla, integrera och testa inbyggda mjukvarukomponenter inom AUTOSAR-ramverket. Du samarbetar nära systemarkitekter, mjukvaruutvecklare och testingenjörer för att säkerställa hög prestanda och efterlevnad av fordonsstandarder.
   Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   
    Designa, utveckla och testa inbyggda mjukvarukomponenter i C inom AUTOSAR Classic eller Adaptive Platform.
    Konfigurera och integrera AUTOSAR BSW-moduler och RTE.
    Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för mjukvaruintegration och verifiering.
    Utföra felsökning, enhetstester och verifiering enligt ASPICE och ISO 26262.
    Identifiera och lösa låg-nivå mjukvaruproblem samt optimera prestanda på mikrokontrollerbaserade plattformar.
    Arbeta med CAN, LIN, Ethernet och UDS-kommunikationsprotokoll.
    Använda verktyg som Vector DaVinci, CANoe/CANalyzer, Git, Jenkins, Jira och Confluence för att effektivt hantera utvecklingsflöden.
   
   VEM DU ÄR
   Vi söker en proaktiv och tekniskt skicklig ingenjör med passion för inbyggda system och mjukvaruutveckling inom fordonsindustrin.
   Din profil:
   
    Civil- eller högskoleingenjörsexamen inom elektroteknik, datavetenskap, mjukvaruteknik eller motsvarande.
    Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling av inbyggda system, gärna inom fordonssektorn.
    Mycket goda kunskaper i C-programmering (låg-nivå inbyggda system).
    Dokumenterad erfarenhet av AUTOSAR (Classic och/eller Adaptive).
    God förståelse för mikrokontrollers (t.ex. Infineon, NXP, Renesas) och hårdvarunära utveckling.
    Erfarenhet av Vector-verktyg (DaVinci Configurator/Developer, PREEvision).
    Kännedom om funktionell säkerhet (ISO 26262) och ASPICE-processer.
    Erfarenhet av felsökningsverktyg som Lauterbach Trace32 eller CANoe.
    Flytande engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   
   Meriterande:
   
    Erfarenhet av C++ eller Python-skriptning.
    Kunskap inom Adaptive AUTOSAR, bootloader-utveckling eller diagnostikstackar (UDS, DoIP).
    Erfarenhet av modellbaserad utveckling (MATLAB/Simulink).
   
   OM ALTEN
   ALTEN är ett av Europas största teknik- och IT-konsultföretag med över 57 000 anställda i närmare 30 länder.
   Våra ingenjörer arbetar med komplexa, högteknologiska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan för ledande företag inom Automotive, Energi, Flyg, Industriell utrustning och Life Science.
   I Sverige är vi cirka 1 300 engagerade medarbetare på 9 kontor – från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr.
   ALTEN har blivit utsedd till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen fem år i rad – ett pris som lyfter fram företag med unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.
   Är du redo att forma framtidens inbyggda mjukvarusystem inom fordonsindustrin?
   Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   Building tomorrow’s world today!
  
 

 


 
  
   Jobb detaljer
  
  
   
    24/10/2025
   
   
    Göteborg Stockholm
   
  
 
 
  
   Rekrytering Kontakt
  
  
   
    ALTEN Sweden
   
   
    recruitment@alten.se

title: Full Stack Developer- SYSTRA, Gothenburg
jobDescription:
: 
 
  SYSTRA develops innovative solutions for sustainable travel and urban development. With around 1200 employees in the Nordics and a strong international network, we combine technical expertise with forward-thinking approaches to create infrastructure and digital solutions for the future. At SYSTRA, you’ll join a team that values innovation, collaboration, and professional growth. We share knowledge across teams and countries, encourage new ideas, and provide opportunities to develop across technical and organizational boundaries.
  Context: 
 
  Do you want to be part of shaping the digital future at SYSTRA Nordic? We are now looking for a Developer to join our team in Gothenburg. In this role, you’ll contribute to innovation projects, drive digital transformation, and help design the solutions that will support our business for years to come. If you thrive in a collaborative environment and have a passion for technology that goes beyond the ordinary, we’d love to hear from you!
  Missions/Main Duties: 
 
  
   As a developer at SYSTRA, you will work at the intersection of innovation, strategy, and technology. Your technical expertise will help us build scalable solutions, modernize our digital landscape, and support our journey toward smarter and more sustainable ways of working.
   
   
    Take the lead in initiatives, proposing and shaping digital solutions.
    Contribute to strategy and architecture discussions for digital platforms.
    Build and develop web services and applications that support our digital transformation.
    Work with technologies such as TypeScript, React, Python, .NET Core, C# and PowerShell.
    Use Azure cloud services as part of delivering scalable and innovative solutions.
    Support projects in areas like automation, data management, and system integrations, and more.
   
  
  Profile/Skills: 
 
  We believe you are a curious and forward-thinking developer with a true enthusiasm for technology, bit of a tech geek at heart. You love exploring new tools and frameworks, seeing opportunities where others see limitations, and are comfortable moving between hands-on development and architectural discussions. You have a structured approach to your work and excel at breaking down complex problems into practical solutions. Your creativity and critical thinking help you deliver results that make a real difference for our business. In addition, you thrive when working independently, but you are also communicative and enjoy collaborating to achieve the best outcomes.
  
   Essential Requirements 
  
   A Bachelor's degree (or equivalent knowledge) and over 3 years of relevant experience within the field.
   Very good knowledge of React, Python, TypeScript, and PowerShell
   Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English, spoken and written.
  
  
   Desirable Qualifications
  
   Microsoft certifications (e.g. Azure Developer Associate, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, Microsoft 365) are an advantage.
   Good knowledge of or certifications (e.g. GitHub Copilot, Coursera, other AI tools)
   Experience with DevOps practices such as CI/CD pipelines, API design, and containerization.
  
   What we offer you
  
   A permanent position with flexibility to work from home a few days a week.
   An opportunity to directly influence our digital transformation journey.
   The chance to work in an international environment with colleagues across the SYSTRA Group with 11000 employees worldwide.
   A workplace that values innovation, collaboration, and work-life balance.
   Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development through training, courses, and knowledge- sharing.
  
   Location and other details
  
    Location: Gothenburg (with hybrid work options)
    Start date: By agreement
    Travel: Some travel may occur
  
   Application
 
 
  
   Selection takes place on an ongoing basis, so you are warmly welcome to submit your application today. Psychometric assessments will be used as part of the process for final candidates.
   
    To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, all applications are handled exclusively through our recruitment system. We therefore ask that you only apply via the advertisement. Applications sent by email will not be processed. If you have any questions or concerns, you are more than welcome to contact one of our representatives listed in the advertisement.
    Contact details
  
  
   Roman Schalizi
  
  
   IT and Digital PMO Manager
  
  
   rschalizi@systra.com
  
  
   Linkedin
   
    Johanna Ekman,
  
  
   Recruitment partner SYSTRA
  
  
   jekman@systra.com
  
  
   Linkedin
   
    SYSTRA- confidence moves the world
  
  : 
  For this recruitment process, SYSTRA has carefully considered recruitment channels and advertising. Therefore, we kindly but firmly ask not to be contacted by media salespeople, recruitment agencies, or similar parties.

title: Function Developer (Vehicle Dynamics)
jobDescription:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same. 
 
 
  
   
    
     Your role  We are looking for a Function Developer to work within Vehicle Dynamics towards our clients in Gothenburg. As a Function Developer you will be involved in all phases of development and maintenance of our interesting, and highly complex end user functions connected to suspension control. You will be a part of a team that innovate new features, implement them and verify them on unit level and complete vehicle level.  In this role you will play a key role in: 
     
      Requirement specification & logic design breakdown 
      Implementation of new features & software updates (C-code and Matlab/Simulink) 
      Tuning of functionality, troubleshooting and hands on testing of features and functionality 
      You will also be a part advanced engineering projects where we test new technology concepts within our area 
      Supporting functional safety work 
     
    
    
     Your profile 
     
      M.Sc. degree in Mechatronics, Control engineering, Computer Science, Electronics or similar 
      Minimum 3+ years' work experience 
      Good knowledge in Mechatronics, Mechanical engineering, Control engineering 
      Familiar with tools such as CANalyzer, Simulink, Matlab as well as rapid prototyping and systems development principles 
      Tools used, GIT, Vector DaVinci, CANoe & CANalyzer, SystemWeaver(SE-TOOL) Knowledge in Volvo Tools, architecture, ISO26262 and C-driving license are beneficial 
     
    
    
     What we believe you will enjoy about working here 
     
      We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance. 
      At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities. 
      We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications. 
     
    
    Application  As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted. 
   
  
 
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.
